summary:
SAP certified consultant with 6 of SAP Sales & Distribution and SAP AFS Experience
Experienced Senior Associate Consultant with a demonstrated history of working in the information technology and services industry with SAP SD and SAP AFS. 

Domain experience of Sales and marketing in the Manufacturing sector for 5 years. 
Skilled in Negotiation, Sales, Sales Management, and Market Analysis. 
Strong consulting professional with an MBA focused in Marketing from Jawaharlal Nehru Technological University.

school.name: Modern Education Society's Nowrosjee Wadia College Arts, Science, Pune 01
Air Force School, Viman Nagar, Maharashtra

certifications.name: SAP Certified Application Associate - Sales and Distribution, ERP 6.0 EhP6

projects.title: Nike - SAP SD AFS
projects.description:
Project Description:
                     Nike, Inc. is an American multinational corporation that is engaged in the design, development, manufacturing, and worldwide marketing and sales of footwear, apparel, equipment, accessories, and services. The company is headquartered near Beaverton, Oregon, in the Portland metropolitan area. It is the world's largest supplier of athletic shoes and apparel and a major manufacturer of sports equipment

Responsibilities: 
•	Member of Advance OMDL Support team. Monitoring 2nd level of Incidents raised and assigned to advance team by Frontline Support. 
•	Work with Integration team i.e., EDI, WMS, Comp Portal. Worked on Incoming and outgoing IDOCS 
•	Work on Sales order (Incoming IDOCS), Invoice, Pricing, VAS Determinations, Customer Master, Allocation.
•	Working on Specific enhancement such as Price exclusion, item category, Incompletion Logs. 
•	Creation of problem tickets as and when repetitive issues are reported. Analyzing issue, if required change request is created if changes are to be completed. 
•	Working on generating reports on weekly basis for the incident raised. As a part of initiative to reduce the incident count. Report was shared with senior level management for analysis.

projects.title: Cooper Standard - SAP SD (OTC)
projects.description:
Project Description:
Cooper-Standard Automotive Inc., headquartered in Novi, Michigan, is an automotive supplier specializing in the manufacture and marketing of systems and components for the automotive industry. Products include body sealing systems, fluid handling systems and NVH control systems, which are represented within the company's two operating divisions: North America and International.

Responsibilities: 
•	Working on COREX document and GAP’s, 
•	Working with BA’s on the requirements as to get the detailed requirements from client for the configuration. 
•	Configuration and maintain Configuration document as per the COREX DRD. 
•	Creating FUT document for configuration done, along with the master data maintenance. 
•	Based on Gaps, preparing FSD document as per the requirement.  
•	Working on Maquila process testing, special requirement of client for orders received for Mexico plants.
•	Working on customer labels.
•	Maintain master data for output triggering. 
•	Worked on Mexico E-Invoice process, configuration and FSD document preparation, which included the monitoring of the COFIDI documents through IDOC. 
•	Worked on the EDI Mapping and End user activity for testing and successful triggering of IDoc copying the existing IDOC.

projects.title: SAB Miller Plc
projects.description:
SABMiller plc is a multinational brewing and Beverage Company headquartered in London, England. It is the world's second-largest brewer measured by revenues. It has operation in 80 countries world-wide.

ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
•	Carrying out testing for primary Distribution. Functionality of process. 
•	End to End scenario testing for Distribution stream.
•	Mapping of scripts against VA200 to HPQC tool.
•	Driving internal tracker update activities
•	Raising defects in HPQC
•	Coordinating with functional team to ensure related defect to be closed soon.

profile_positions.description:
Nike - SAP SD AFS
Sep 2017 – Present

Project Description:
Nike, Inc. is an American multinational corporation that is engaged in the design, development, manufacturing, and worldwide marketing and sales of footwear, apparel, equipment, accessories, and services. The company is headquartered near Beaverton, Oregon, in the Portland metropolitan area. It is the world's largest supplier of athletic shoes and apparel and a major manufacturer of sports equipment

Responsibilities:
• 	Managing Order Management and Deliver track for a leader in the Apparel and Footwear Industry. 
•	Drive the functional Advanced Process function through the on-site client-facing presence and through coordination with functional, technical, on-site, and offshore teams to collaborate on best-fit solutions, escalation management, design/system configuration, and root cause analysis.
•	Resolution of Incident within SLA. 
•	Addressing EMEA user's queries within SAP and interacting with various teams to resolve them.
•	Managing client relationships.  
•	Part of Incident Management, Problem Management, and Change Management related activities.
•	Project based on Agile methodology which was the basis of functioning the project.   
•	Identifying Automation and innovation ideas for continuous service improvement. 
•	Identifying new opportunities and lead generation with continuous client engagement. 
•	Involved in design, preparation, and review of AID (Application Information Document) and KBA (Knowledge-Based artifacts) on client requirements.
